    • Method Detail

      • get

        public Object get(String key)
        Retrieves the value associated with the provided key. The key can be composed of different grouping names separated by a dot ("."). If the key targets a parent group, it is returned as a Map<String, Object>
        Parameters:
        key - the config key
        Returns:
        the associated value or null if the key is not found
        Note:
        the key is case sensitive

      • gets

        public String gets(String key)
        Retrieves the String value associated with the provided key or its .toString() counterpart. The key can be composed of different grouping names separated by a dot (".").
        Parameters:
        key - the config key
        Returns:
        the associated value or null if the key is not found
        Note:
        the key is case sensitive

      • gets

        public String gets(Object instance,
          String key)
        Retrieves the String value associated with the provided key under the grouping name part defined by the provided instance's canonical name.
        Example: for gets(new Object(), "foo"), the key searched is java.lang.Object.foo
        Parameters:
        instance - the key prefix
        key - the config key
        Returns:
        the associated value or null if the key is not found
        See Also:
        gets(String)

      • set

        public void set(String key,
       Object value)
        Sets a config value at the target entry key The key can be composed of different grouping names separated by a dot ("."). If the key targets a parent group or an existing key, it is overriden. If the key targets a non-existing key, it is created on the fly.
        Parameters:
        key - the config key
        value - the config value
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if the ket targets an existing value as a group
        Note:
        the key is case sensitive

      • set

        public void set(Object instance,
       String key,
       Object value)
        Sets a config value at the target entry key under the grouping name part defined by the provided instance's canonical name.
        Example: for gets(new Object(), "foo"), the key searched is java.lang.Object.foo
        Parameters:
        instance - the key prefix
        key - the config key
        value - the config value
        See Also:
        set(String, Object)

      • load

        public void load(String path)
          throws Exception
        Loads the target XML file and merge all values. If a value already exists at that key, it is changed to a Collection and both values exist; if the existing value was already a Collection, the new value is added. If a group already exists in the key path, all values are merged.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the XML file
        Throws:
        Exception

      • load

        public void load(InputStream stream)
          throws Exception
        Loads the target XML stream and merge all values. If a value already exists at that key, it is changed to a Collection and both values exist; if the existing value was already a Collection, the new value is added. If a group already exists in the key path, all values are merged.
        Parameters:
        stream - the stream containing XML data
        Throws:
        Exception
